attributes.action: Gyms to be kept open during COVID-19
attributes.additional_details: The gyms have a huge impact on not just physical health but mental health too. In such a stressful time people need a viable way to exercise. For a lot of people this could drastically improve and help with their mental health.
attributes.background: Allow gyms to be open with a reduced amount of members. Gyms follow strict guidelines and one of the few places that hold lower rates of COVID-19. Correct procedures and social distancing in place, gyms could remain open which would help and save the physical and mental well being of the country.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Keep gyms and leisure facilities open during any lockdown: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/556956

Prevent gyms closing due to a spike in Covid 19 cases: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/333869

The Committee will be holding a debate on Covid-19 restrictions on gyms and sport on Monday 23 November. You will be able to watch the debate on Parliament TV at 4.30pm: https://www.parliamentlive.tv/Commons
